N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 54.1 - General

State Regulations

Every person effecting any delivery or transfer of a
certificate of stock or other certificate subject to the provisions of article
12 of the Tax Law and claiming an exemption from tax as provided in such
article must execute a certification setting forth briefly the specific facts
giving rise to the exemption claimed (including a citation of the statutory
provision which is the basis for the exemption). The certification used by any
person effecting any such delivery or transfer shall bear the facsimile
signature of such person and, if a corporation, firm or other entity, shall
bear as signature the name of such entity and the facsimile authorized
signature of an officer, partner or other authorized person thereof. If a
rubber stamp is used (see section
50.1
[k]
of this Title), it shall be kept in the possession of such person or such
officer, partner or other authorized person of such entity, and used only by
such person or other authorized user, or by a duly designated representative
thereof. The certification and any evidence in proof of any claimed exemption
must be maintained by the person making such claim and must be made available
for inspection by officers and representatives of the department, in accordance
with the provisions of section
276
of the Tax Law. Notes
